Text

[Harry Potter]117-harry was [a highly unusual boy]372-a highly unusual boy in many ways . For one thing , [he]117-harry hated the summer holidays more than any other time of year . For another , [he]117-harry really wanted to do [his]117-harry homework but was forced to do it in secret , in the dead of night . And [he]117-harry also happened to be [a wizard]373-a wizard .

It was nearly midnight , and [he]117-harry was lying on [his]117-harry stomach in bed , the blankets drawn right over [his]117-harry head like a tent , a flashlight in one hand and a large leather - bound book ( A History of Magic by [Bathilda Bagshot]118-bathilda bagshot ) propped open against the pillow . [Harry]117-harry moved the tip of [his]117-harry eagle - feather quill down the page , frowning as [he]117-harry looked for something that would help [him]117-harry write [his]117-harry essay , “ Witch Burning in the Fourteenth Century Was Completely Pointless — discuss . ”[117-harry]

The quill paused at the top of a likely - looking paragraph . [Harry]117-harry pushed [his]117-harry round glasses up the bridge of [his]117-harry nose , moved [his]117-harry flashlight closer to the book , and read :

[Non - magic people]374-non - magic people ( more commonly known as [Muggles]120-muggles ) were particularly afraid of magic in medieval times , but not very good at recognizing it . On the rare occasion that [they]374-non - magic people did catch [a real witch or wizard]375-a real witch or wizard , burning had no effect whatsoever . [The witch or wizard]376-the witch or wizard would perform a basic Flame - Freezing Charm and then pretend to shriek with pain while enjoying a gentle , tickling sensation . Indeed , [Wendelin the Weird]121-wendelin the weird enjoyed being burned so much that [she]121-wendelin the weird allowed [herself]121-wendelin the weird to be caught no less than forty - seven times in various disguises .

[Harry]117-harry put [his]117-harry quill between [his]117-harry teeth and reached underneath [his]117-harry pillow for [his]117-harry ink bottle and a roll of parchment . Slowly and very carefully [he]117-harry unscrewed the ink bottle , dipped [his]117-harry quill into it , and began to write , pausing every now and then to listen , because if any of [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys heard the scratching of [his]117-harry quill on [their]377-their way to [the bathroom]378-the bathroom , [he]117-harry ’d probably find [himself]117-harry locked in the cupboard under the stairs for the rest of the summer .

[The Dursley family of number four]379-the dursley family of number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , was the reason that [Harry]117-harry never enjoyed [his]117-harry summer holidays . [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia , and [[their]380-they son]381-their son , [Dudley]125-dudley , were [[Harry]117-harry ’s only living relatives]382-harry ’s only living relatives . [They]379-the dursley family of number four were [Muggles]383-muggles , and [they]379-the dursley family of number four had a very medieval attitude toward magic . [[Harry]117-harry ’s dead parents , who had been [a witch]385-a witch and [wizard]386-wizard [themselves]384-harry ’s dead parents , who had been a witch and wizard themselves]384-harry ’s dead parents , who had been a witch and wizard themselves , were never mentioned under [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys ’ roof . For years , [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon had hoped that if [they]380-they kept [Harry]117-harry as downtrodden as possible , [they]380-they would be able to squash the magic out of [him]117-harry . To [their]380-they fury , [they]380-they had been unsuccessful . These days [they]380-they lived in terror of [anyone]387-anyone finding out that [Harry]117-harry had spent most of the last two years at [Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]2-hogwarts school of witchcraft and wizardry . The most [they]380-they could do , however , was to lock away [Harry]117-harry ’s spellbooks , wand , cauldron , and broomstick at the start of the summer break , and forbid [him]117-harry to talk to [the neighbors]388-the neighbors .

This separation from [his]117-harry spellbooks had been a real problem for [Harry]117-harry , because [[his]117-harry teachers]389-his teachers at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts had given [him]117-harry a lot of holiday work . One of the essays , a particularly nasty one about shrinking potions , was for [[Harry]117-harry ’s least favorite teacher]390-harry ’s least favorite teacher , [Professor Snape]260-snape , who would be delighted to have an excuse to give [Harry]117-harry detention for a month . [Harry]117-harry had therefore seized [his]117-harry chance in the first week of the holidays . While [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia , and [Dudley]125-dudley had gone out into [the front garden]391-the front garden to admire [[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s new company car]392-uncle vernon ’s new company car ( in very loud voices , so that [the rest of [the street]394-the street]393-the rest of the street would notice it too ) , [Harry]117-harry had crept [downstairs]395-downstairs , picked the lock on the cupboard under the stairs , grabbed some of [his]117-harry books , and hidden them in [[his]117-harry bedroom]396-his bedroom . As long as [he]117-harry did n’t leave spots of ink on the sheets , [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys need never know that [he]117-harry was studying magic by night .

[Harry]117-harry was particularly keen to avoid trouble with [[his]117-harry aunt]397-his aunt and [uncle]398-uncle at the moment , as [they]399-they were already in an especially bad mood with [him]117-harry , all because [he]117-harry ’d received a telephone call from [a fellow wizard]400-a fellow wizard one week into the school vacation .

[Ron Weasley]127-ron , who was [one of [[Harry]117-harry ’s best friends at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts]402-harry ’s best friends at hogwarts]401-one of harry ’s best friends at hogwarts , came from [a whole family of wizards]403-a whole family of wizards . This meant that [he]117-harry knew a lot of things [Harry]117-harry did n’t , but had never used a telephone before . Most unluckily , it had been [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon who had answered the call .

“ [Vernon Dursley]128-vernon dursley speaking . ”[123-uncle vernon]

[Harry]117-harry , who happened to be in [the room]404-the room at the time , froze as [he]117-harry heard [Ron]127-ron ’s voice answer .

“ HELLO ? HELLO ? CAN [YOU]117-harry HEAR [ME]127-ron ? [I]127-ron — WANT — TO — TALK — TO — [HARRY]117-harry — POTTER ! ”[127-ron]

[Ron]127-ron was yelling so loudly that [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon jumped and held the receiver a foot away from [his]127-ron ear , staring at it with an expression of mingled fury and alarm .

“ WHO IS THIS ? ”[123-uncle vernon] [he]123-uncle vernon roared in the direction of the mouthpiece . “ WHO ARE [YOU]127-ron ? ”[123-uncle vernon]

“ [RON]127-ron — [WEASLEY]5-weasley ! ”[127-ron] [Ron]127-ron bellowed back , as though [he]127-ron and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon were speaking from opposite ends of [a football field]405-a football field . “ [I’M]127-ron — [A — FRIEND — OF — HARRY]2637-a — friend — of — harry ’S — FROM — SCHOOL — ”[127-ron]

[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s small eyes swiveled around to [Harry]117-harry , who was rooted to the spot .

“ THERE IS NO [HARRY POTTER]117-harry HERE ! ”[123-uncle vernon] [he]123-uncle vernon roared , now holding the receiver at arm ’s length , as though frightened it might explode . “ [I]123-uncle vernon DON’T KNOW WHAT SCHOOL YOU’RE TALKING ABOUT ! NEVER CONTACT [ME]123-uncle vernon AGAIN ! DON’T [YOU]117-harry COME NEAR [[MY]123-uncle vernon FAMILY]2638-my family ! ”[123-uncle vernon]

And [he]123-uncle vernon threw the receiver back onto the telephone as if dropping a poisonous spider .

The fight that had followed had been one of the worst ever .

“ HOW DARE [YOU]127-ron GIVE THIS NUMBER TO PEOPLE LIKE — PEOPLE LIKE [YOU]127-ron ! ”[123-uncle vernon] [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon had roared , spraying [Harry]117-harry with spit .

[Ron]127-ron obviously realized that [he]127-ron ’d gotten [Harry]117-harry into trouble , because [he]127-ron had n’t called again . [[Harry]117-harry ’s other best friend from [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts]406-harry ’s other best friend from hogwarts , [Hermione Granger]313-hermione , had n’t been in touch either . [Harry]117-harry suspected that [Ron]127-ron had warned [Hermione]313-hermione not to call , which was a pity , because [Hermione]313-hermione , [the cleverest witch in [Harry]117-harry ’s year]407-the cleverest witch in harry ’s year , had [Muggle parents]408-muggle parents , knew perfectly well how to use a telephone , and would probably have had enough sense not to say that [she]313-hermione went to [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts .

So [Harry]117-harry had had no word from [any of [[his]117-harry wizarding friends]410-his wizarding friends]409-any of his wizarding friends for five long weeks , and this summer was turning out to be almost as bad as the last one . There was just one very small improvement — after swearing that [he]117-harry would n’t use [Hedwig]130-hedwig to send letters to [any of [[his]117-harry friends]412-his friends]411-any of his friends , [Harry]117-harry had been allowed to let [his]117-harry owl Hedwig out at night . [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon had given in because of the racket [Hedwig]130-hedwig made if [she]130-hedwig was locked in [[her]130-hedwig cage]413-her cage all the time .

[Harry]117-harry finished writing about [Wendelin the Weird]121-wendelin the weird and paused to listen again . The silence in [the dark house]414-the dark house was broken only by the distant , grunting snores of [[his]117-harry enormous cousin]415-his enormous cousin , [Dudley]125-dudley . It must be very late , [Harry]117-harry thought . [His]117-harry eyes were itching with tiredness . Perhaps [he]117-harry ’d finish this essay tomorrow night ...

[He]117-harry replaced the top of the ink bottle ; pulled an old pillowcase from under [his]117-harry bed ; put the flashlight , A History of Magic , [his]117-harry essay , quill , and ink inside it ; got out of bed ; and hid the lot under a loose floorboard under [his]117-harry bed . Then [he]117-harry stood up , stretched , and checked the time on the luminous alarm clock on [his]117-harry bedside table .

It was one o’clock in the morning . [Harry]117-harry ’s stomach gave a funny jolt . [He]117-harry had been thirteen years old , without realizing it , for a whole hour .

Yet another unusual thing about [Harry]117-harry was how little [he]117-harry looked forward to [his]117-harry birthdays . [He]117-harry had never received a birthday card in [his]117-harry life . [The Dursleys]122-the dursleys had completely ignored [his]117-harry last two birthdays , and [he]117-harry had no reason to suppose [they]416-they would remember this one .

[Harry]117-harry walked across [the dark room]417-the dark room , past [[Hedwig]130-hedwig ’s large , empty cage]418-hedwig ’s large , empty cage , to the open window . [He]117-harry leaned on the sill , the cool night air pleasant on [his]117-harry face after a long time under the blankets . [Hedwig]130-hedwig had been absent for two nights now . [Harry]117-harry was n’t worried about [her]130-hedwig : [She]130-hedwig ’d been gone this long before . But [he]117-harry hoped [she]130-hedwig ’d be back soon — [she]130-hedwig was the only living creature in [this house]419-this house who did n’t flinch at the sight of [him]117-harry .

[Harry]117-harry , though still rather small and skinny for [his]117-harry age , had grown a few inches over the last year . [His]117-harry jet - black hair , however , was just as it always had been — stubbornly untidy , whatever [he]117-harry did to it . The eyes behind [his]117-harry glasses were bright green , and on [his]117-harry forehead , clearly visible through [his]117-harry hair , was a thin scar , shaped like a bolt of lightning .

Of all the unusual things about [Harry]117-harry , this scar was the most extraordinary of all . It was not , as [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys had pretended for ten years , a souvenir of the car crash that had killed [[Harry]117-harry ’s parents]420-harry ’s parents , because [Lily]131-lily and [James Potter]132-james had not died in a car crash . [They]420-harry ’s parents had been murdered , murdered by the most feared Dark wizard for a hundred years , [Lord Voldemort]133-voldemort . [Harry]117-harry had escaped from the same attack with nothing more than a scar on [his]117-harry forehead , where [Voldemort]133-voldemort ’s curse , instead of killing [him]117-harry , had rebounded upon its originator . Barely alive , [Voldemort]133-voldemort had fled ...

But [Harry]117-harry had come face - to - face with [him]133-voldemort at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts . Remembering [their]421-their last meeting as [he]117-harry stood at the dark window , [Harry]117-harry had to admit [he]117-harry was lucky even to have reached [his]117-harry thirteenth birthday .

[He]117-harry scanned the starry sky for a sign of [Hedwig]130-hedwig , perhaps soaring back to [him]117-harry with a dead mouse dangling from [her]130-hedwig beak , expecting praise . Gazing absently over [the rooftops]422-the rooftops , it was a few seconds before [Harry]117-harry realized what [he]117-harry was seeing .

Silhouetted against the golden moon , and growing larger every moment , was [a large , strangely lopsided creature]423-a large , strangely lopsided creature , and it was flapping in [Harry]117-harry ’s direction . [He]117-harry stood quite still , watching it sink lower and lower . For a split second [he]117-harry hesitated , [his]117-harry hand on the window latch , wondering whether to slam it shut . But then [the bizarre creature]424-the bizarre creature soared over [one of the street lamps of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]425-one of the street lamps of privet drive , and [Harry]117-harry , realizing what it was , leapt aside .

Through the window soared three owls , two of [them]426-them holding up the third , which appeared to be unconscious . [They]426-them landed with a soft flump on [Harry]117-harry ’s bed , and the middle owl , which was large and gray , keeled right over and lay motionless . There was a large package tied to its legs .

[Harry]117-harry recognized [the unconscious owl]427-the unconscious owl at once — [his]427-the unconscious owl name was [Errol]134-errol , and [he]427-the unconscious owl belonged to [the Weasley family]428-the weasley family . [Harry]117-harry dashed to the bed , untied the cords around [Errol]134-errol ’s legs , took off the parcel , and then carried [Errol]134-errol to [[Hedwig]130-hedwig ’s cage]429-hedwig ’s cage . [Errol]134-errol opened one bleary eye , gave a feeble hoot of thanks , and began to gulp some water .

[Harry]117-harry turned back to the remaining owls . One of [them]426-them , [the large snowy female]430-the large snowy female , was [his]117-harry own [Hedwig]130-hedwig . [She]130-hedwig , too , was carrying a parcel and looked extremely pleased with [herself]130-hedwig . [She]130-hedwig gave [Harry]117-harry an affectionate nip with [her]130-hedwig beak as [he]117-harry removed [her]130-hedwig burden , then flew across [the room]404-the room to join [Errol]134-errol .

[Harry]117-harry did n’t recognize [the third owl]432-the third owl , [a handsome tawny one]433-a handsome tawny one , but [he]117-harry knew at once where it had come from , because in addition to a third package , it was carrying a letter bearing the Hogwarts crest . When [Harry]117-harry relieved this owl of [its]432-the third owl burden , it ruffled its feathers importantly , stretched its wings , and took off through the window into the night .

[Harry]117-harry sat down on [his]117-harry bed and grabbed [Errol]134-errol ’s package , ripped off the brown paper , and discovered a present wrapped in gold , and [his]117-harry first - ever birthday card . Fingers trembling slightly , [he]117-harry opened the envelope . Two pieces of paper fell out — a letter and a newspaper clipping .

[MINISTRY OF MAGIC EMPLOYEE SCOOPS GRAND PRIZE]435-ministry of magic employee scoops grand prize

[He]117-harry picked up [Ron]127-ron ’s letter and unfolded it .

[Dear Harry]117-harry ,

Happy birthday !

[Harry]117-harry glanced back at the photograph . [Percy]143-percy , who was in [his]143-percy seventh and final year at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts , was looking particularly smug . [Harry]117-harry laughed as [he]117-harry put [Hermione]313-hermione ’s letter aside and picked up [her]313-hermione present . It was very heavy . [Knowing Hermione]313-hermione , [he]117-harry was sure it would be a large book full of very difficult spells — but it was n’t . [His]117-harry heart gave a huge bound as [he]117-harry ripped back the paper and saw a sleek black leather case , with silver words stamped across it , reading Broomstick Servicing Kit .

“ Wow , [Hermione]313-hermione ! ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry whispered , unzipping the case to look inside .

There was a large jar of [Fleetwood]149-fleetwood ’s High - Finish Handle Polish , a pair of gleaming silver Tail - Twig Clippers , a tiny brass compass to clip on [your]117-harry broom for long journeys , and a Handbook of [Do - It - Yourself Broomcare]15-do - it - yourself broomcare .

Apart from [[his]117-harry friends]412-his friends , the thing that [Harry]117-harry missed most about [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts was Quidditch , the most popular sport in [the magical world]469-the magical world — highly dangerous , very exciting , and played on broomsticks . [Harry]117-harry happened to be [a very good Quidditch player]470-a very good quidditch player ; [he]117-harry had been [the youngest person in a century]471-the youngest person in a century to be picked for [one of [the Hogwarts House teams]473-the hogwarts house teams]472-one of the hogwarts house teams . One of [Harry]117-harry ’s most prized possessions was [his]117-harry Nimbus Two Thousand racing broom .

[Harry]117-harry put the leather case aside and picked up [his]117-harry last parcel . [He]117-harry recognized the untidy scrawl on the brown paper at once : This was from [Hagrid]305-hagrid , [the Hogwarts gamekeeper]474-the hogwarts gamekeeper . [He]117-harry tore off the top layer of paper and glimpsed something green and leathery , but before [he]117-harry could unwrap it properly , the parcel gave a strange quiver , and whatever was inside it snapped loudly — as though it had jaws .

[Harry]117-harry froze . [He]117-harry knew that [Hagrid]305-hagrid would never send [him]117-harry anything dangerous on purpose , but then , [Hagrid]305-hagrid did n’t have [a normal person]475-a normal person ’s view of what was dangerous . [Hagrid]305-hagrid had been known to befriend giant spiders , buy vicious , three - headed dogs from [men in pubs]476-men in pubs , and sneak illegal dragon eggs into [[his]305-hagrid cabin]477-his cabin .

[Harry]117-harry poked the parcel nervously . It snapped loudly again . [Harry]117-harry reached for the lamp on [his]117-harry bedside table , gripped it firmly in one hand , and raised it over [his]117-harry head , ready to strike . Then [he]117-harry seized the rest of the wrapping paper in [his]117-harry other hand and pulled .

And out fell — a book . [Harry]117-harry just had time to register its handsome green cover , emblazoned with the golden title The Monster Book of Monsters , before it flipped onto its edge and scuttled sideways along the bed like some weird crab .

“ Uh - oh , ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry muttered .

The book toppled off the bed with a loud clunk and shuffled rapidly across [the room]404-the room . [Harry]117-harry followed it stealthily . The book was hiding in the dark space under [his]117-harry desk . Praying that [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys were still fast asleep , [Harry]117-harry got down on [his]117-harry hands and knees and reached toward it .

“ Ouch ! ”[117-harry]

The book snapped shut on [his]117-harry hand and then flapped past [him]117-harry , still scuttling on its covers . [Harry]117-harry scrambled around , threw [himself]117-harry forward , and managed to flatten it . [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon gave a loud , sleepy grunt in [the room next door]479-the room next door .

[Hedwig]130-hedwig and [Errol]134-errol watched interestedly as [Harry]117-harry clamped the struggling book tightly in [his]117-harry arms , hurried to [his]117-harry chest of drawers , and pulled out a belt , which [he]117-harry buckled tightly around it . The Monster Book shuddered angrily , but could no longer flap and snap , so [Harry]117-harry threw it down on the bed and reached for [Hagrid]305-hagrid ’s card .

[Dear Harry]117-harry ,

Happy birthday !

Think [you]117-harry might find this useful for next year . Wo n’t say no more here . Tell [you]117-harry when [I]0-i see [you]117-harry .

Hope [the Muggles]120-muggles are treating [you]117-harry right .

All the best ,

[Hagrid]305-hagrid .

It struck [Harry]117-harry as ominous that [Hagrid]305-hagrid thought a biting book would come in useful , but [he]117-harry put [Hagrid]305-hagrid ’s card up next to [Ron]147-ron ’s and [Hermione]313-hermione ’s , grinning more broadly than ever . [Dear Mr. Potter]151-mr. potter ,

Please note that the new school year will begin on September the first . [The Hogwarts Express]13-the hogwarts express will leave from [King ’s Cross station]480-king ’s cross station , platform nine and three - quarters , at eleven o’clock .

[Harry]117-harry pulled out the Hogsmeade permission form and looked at it , no longer grinning . [He]117-harry looked over at the alarm clock . It was now two o’clock in the morning .

“ [Marge’ll]157-marge’ll be [here]2650-here for a week , ”[123-uncle vernon] [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon snarled , “ and while [we]2652-we ’re on the subject ”[123-uncle vernon] — [he]123-uncle vernon pointed a fat finger threateningly at [Harry]117-harry — “ [we]2652-we need to get a few things straight before [I]123-uncle vernon go and collect [her]154-aunt marge . ”[123-uncle vernon]

[Dudley]125-dudley smirked and withdrew [his]125-dudley gaze from the television . Watching [Harry]117-harry being bullied by [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon was [Dudley]125-dudley ’s favorite form of entertainment .

“ Secondly , ”[123-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , acting as though [he]123-uncle vernon had not heard [Harry]117-harry ’s reply , “ as [Marge]154-aunt marge does n’t know anything about [your]117-harry abnormality , [I]123-uncle vernon do n’t want any — any funny stuff while [she]154-aunt marge ’s [here]2650-here . “ [I]117-harry will if [she]154-aunt marge does , ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry through gritted teeth .

“ And thirdly , ”[123-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , [his]123-uncle vernon mean little eyes now slits in [his]123-uncle vernon great purple face , “ [we]2654-we ’ve told [Marge]154-aunt marge [you]117-harry attend [[St. Brutus]158-st. brutus ’s Secure [Center for Incurably Criminal Boys]2656-center for incurably criminal boys]2655-st. brutus ’s secure center for incurably criminal boys . ”[123-uncle vernon]

“ What ? ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry yelled .

“ And [you]117-harry ’ll be sticking to that story , [boy]2657-boy , or there ’ll be trouble , ”[123-uncle vernon] spat [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon .

[Harry]117-harry sat there , white - faced and furious , staring at [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , hardly able to believe it . [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge coming for a week - long visit — it was the worst birthday present [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys had ever given [him]123-uncle vernon , including that pair of [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s old socks .

“ Well , [Petunia]124-aunt petunia , ”[123-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , getting heavily to [his]123-uncle vernon feet , “ [I]123-uncle vernon ’ll be off to [the station]2658-the station , then . Want to come along for the ride , [Dudders]159-dudders ? ”[123-uncle vernon]

[Harry]117-harry , who had been sitting in a kind of horrified trance , had a sudden idea . Abandoning [his]117-harry toast , [he]117-harry got quickly to [his]117-harry feet and followed [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon to the front door .

[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon was pulling on [his]123-uncle vernon car coat .

“ [I]123-uncle vernon ’m not taking [you]125-dudley , ”[123-uncle vernon] [he]123-uncle vernon snarled as [he]123-uncle vernon turned to see [Harry]117-harry watching [him]123-uncle vernon .

[He]123-uncle vernon wheeled around , pulled open the front door , and slammed it so hard that one of the little panes of glass at the top fell out .

[Harry]117-harry did n’t return to [the kitchen]491-the kitchen . [He]117-harry went back [upstairs]505-upstairs to [[his]117-harry bedroom]396-his bedroom . But [Harry]117-harry did n’t have long to brood . In next to no time , [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia was shrieking up the stairs for [Harry]117-harry to come down and get ready to welcome [[their]520-their guest]521-their guest .

“ Do something about [your]117-harry hair ! ”[124-aunt petunia] [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia snapped as [he]117-harry reached [the hall]522-the hall .

[Harry]117-harry could n’t see the point of trying to make [his]117-harry hair lie flat . [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge loved criticizing [him]117-harry , so the untidier [he]117-harry looked , the happier [she]154-aunt marge would be .

[She]154-aunt marge was very like [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon : Large , beefy , and purple - faced , [she]154-aunt marge even had a mustache , though not as bushy as [his]117-harry . Perhaps [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon was worried that [Harry]117-harry might forget [their]538-their bargain ; in any case , [he]123-uncle vernon changed the subject abruptly .

“ Heard the news this morning , [Marge]154-aunt marge ? What about [that escaped prisoner]2676-that escaped prisoner , eh ? ”[123-uncle vernon]

[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon and [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia usually encouraged [Harry]117-harry to stay out of [their]538-their way , which [Harry]117-harry was only too happy to do . [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge , on the other hand , wanted [Harry]117-harry under [her]154-aunt marge eye at all times , so that [she]154-aunt marge could boom out suggestions for [his]117-harry improvement . [She]154-aunt marge delighted in comparing [Harry]117-harry with [Dudley]125-dudley , and took huge pleasure in buying [Dudley]125-dudley expensive presents while glaring at [Harry]117-harry , as though daring [him]117-harry to ask why [he]117-harry had n’t got a present too . [She]154-aunt marge also kept throwing out dark hints about what made [Harry]117-harry such [an unsatisfactory person]540-an unsatisfactory person .

“ [You]117-harry must n’t blame [yourself]117-harry for the way [the boy]2677-the boy ’s turned out , [Vernon]123-uncle vernon , ”[154-aunt marge] [she]154-aunt marge said over lunch on the third day . “ If there ’s something rotten on the inside , there ’s nothing [anyone]387-anyone can do about it . ”[154-aunt marge]

[Harry]117-harry tried to concentrate on [his]117-harry food , but [his]117-harry hands shook and [his]117-harry face was starting to burn with anger . Remember the form , [he]117-harry told [himself]117-harry . Think about [Hogsmeade]16-hogsmeade . Do n’t say anything . Do n’t rise —

[Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge reached for [her]154-aunt marge glass of wine .

“ It ’s one of the basic rules of breeding , ”[154-aunt marge] [she]154-aunt marge said . “ [You]123-uncle vernon see it all the time with dogs . If there ’s something wrong with [the bitch]2679-the bitch , there ’ll be something wrong with the pup — ”[154-aunt marge]

At that moment , the wineglass [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge was holding exploded in [her]154-aunt marge hand . Shards of glass flew in every direction and [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge sputtered and blinked , [her]154-aunt marge great ruddy face dripping .

“ [Marge]154-aunt marge ! ”[124-aunt petunia] squealed [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia . “ [Marge]154-aunt marge , are [you]154-aunt marge all right ? ”[124-aunt petunia]

“ Not to worry , ”[154-aunt marge] grunted [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge , mopping [her]154-aunt marge face with [her]154-aunt marge napkin . “ Must have squeezed it too hard . But [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon were both looking at [Harry]117-harry suspiciously , so [he]117-harry decided [he]117-harry ’d better skip dessert and escape from the table as soon as [he]117-harry could .

Outside in [the hall]522-the hall , [he]117-harry leaned against the wall , breathing deeply . It had been a long time since [he]117-harry ’d lost control and made something explode . [He]117-harry could n’t afford to let it happen again . The Hogsmeade form was n’t the only thing at stake — if [he]117-harry carried on like that , [he]117-harry ’d be in trouble with [the Ministry of Magic]437-the ministry of magic .

[Harry]117-harry was still [an underage wizard]543-an underage wizard , and [he]117-harry was forbidden by wizard law to do magic outside school . [His]117-harry record was n’t exactly clean either . Only last summer [he]117-harry ’d gotten an official warning that had stated quite clearly that if [the Ministry]544-the ministry got wind of any more magic in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , [Harry]117-harry would face expulsion from [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts .

[He]117-harry heard [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys leaving the table and hurried [upstairs]505-upstairs out of the way .

[Harry]117-harry got through the next three days by forcing [himself]117-harry to think about [his]117-harry Handbook of Do - It - [Yourself]546-yourself Broomcare whenever [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge started on [him]117-harry . This worked quite well , though it seemed to give [him]117-harry a glazed look , because [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge started voicing the opinion that [he]117-harry was mentally subnormal .

At last , at long last , the final evening of [Marge]154-aunt marge ’s stay arrived . [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia cooked a fancy dinner and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon uncorked several bottles of wine . [They]547-they got all the way through the soup and the salmon without a single mention of [Harry]117-harry ’s faults ; during the lemon meringue pie , [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon bored [them]547-they all with a long talk about [Grunnings]164-grunnings , [his]123-uncle vernon drill - making company ; then [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia made coffee and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon brought out a bottle of brandy .

“ Can [I]123-uncle vernon tempt [you]154-aunt marge , [Marge]154-aunt marge ? ”[123-uncle vernon]

[Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge had already had quite a lot of wine . [Her]154-aunt marge huge face was very red .

“ Just a small one , then , ”[154-aunt marge] [she]154-aunt marge chuckled . “ A bit more than that ... and a bit more ... that ’s the ticket . ”[154-aunt marge]

[Dudley]125-dudley was eating [his]125-dudley fourth slice of pie . [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia was sipping coffee with [her]124-aunt petunia little finger sticking out . [Harry]117-harry really wanted to disappear into [[his]117-harry bedroom]396-his bedroom , but [he]117-harry met [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s angry little eyes and knew [he]117-harry would have to sit it out .

“ Aah , ”[154-aunt marge] said [Aunt Marge]154-aunt marge , smacking [her]154-aunt marge lips and putting the empty brandy glass back down . “ Excellent nosh , [Petunia]124-aunt petunia . It ’s normally just a fry - up for [me]154-aunt marge of an evening , with twelve dogs to look after ... ”[154-aunt marge] [She]154-aunt marge burped richly and patted [her]154-aunt marge great tweed stomach . “ Pardon [me]154-aunt marge . But [I]154-aunt marge do like to see [a healthy - sized boy]2680-a healthy - sized boy , ”[154-aunt marge] [she]154-aunt marge went on , winking at [Dudley]125-dudley . “ [You]2680-a healthy - sized boy ’ll be [a proper - sized man]2681-a proper - sized man , [Dudders]159-dudders , like [[your]2680-a healthy - sized boy father]2682-your father . Yes , [I]154-aunt marge ’ll have a spot more brandy , [Vernon]123-uncle vernon ...[154-aunt marge]

“ Now , this one here — ”[154-aunt marge]

[She]154-aunt marge jerked [her]154-aunt marge head at [Harry]117-harry , who felt [his]117-harry stomach clench . [The Handbook]165-the handbook , [he]117-harry thought quickly .

“ [This one]2683-this one ’s got a mean , runty look about [him]2683-this one . [You]2680-a healthy - sized boy get that with dogs . [I]154-aunt marge had [Colonel Fubster]162-colonel fubster drown one last year . Ratty little thing it was . Weak . Underbred . ”[154-aunt marge]

[Harry]117-harry was trying to remember page twelve of [his]117-harry book : A Charm to [Cure Reluctant Reversers]166-cure reluctant reversers .

“ It all comes down to blood , as [I]154-aunt marge was saying the other day . Bad blood will out . Now , [I]154-aunt marge ’m saying nothing against [[your]117-harry family]2684-your family , [Petunia]124-aunt petunia ”[154-aunt marge] — [she]154-aunt marge patted [Aunt Petunia]124-aunt petunia ’s bony hand with [her]154-aunt marge shovel - like one — “ but [[your]117-harry sister]2685-your sister was a bad egg . [Harry]117-harry was staring at [his]117-harry plate , a funny ringing in [his]117-harry ears . Grasp [your]549-your broom firmly by the tail , [he]117-harry thought . [Harry]117-harry tore from [the dining room]552-the dining room before [anyone]387-anyone could stop [him]117-harry , heading for the cupboard under the stairs . “ [She]130-hedwig deserved it , ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry said , breathing very fast . “ [She]130-hedwig deserved what [she]130-hedwig got . [You]117-harry keep away from [me]117-harry . ”[117-harry]

[He]117-harry fumbled behind [him]117-harry for the latch on the door .

[Harry]117-harry was several streets away before [he]117-harry collapsed onto a low wall in [Magnolia Crescent]20-magnolia crescent , panting from the effort of dragging [his]117-harry trunk . [He]117-harry sat quite still , anger still surging through [him]117-harry , listening to the frantic thumping of [his]117-harry heart .

But after ten minutes alone in [the dark street]558-the dark street , a new emotion overtook [him]117-harry : panic . Whichever way [he]117-harry looked at it , [he]117-harry had never been in a worse fix . [He]117-harry was stranded , quite alone , in [the dark Muggle world]559-the dark muggle world , with absolutely nowhere to go . And the worst of it was , [he]117-harry had just done serious magic , which meant that [he]117-harry was almost certainly expelled from [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts . [He]117-harry had broken the Decree for the Restriction of Underage Wizardry so badly , [he]117-harry was surprised [Ministry of Magic representatives]560-ministry of magic representatives were n’t swooping down on [him]117-harry where [he]117-harry sat .

[Harry]117-harry shivered and looked up and down [Magnolia Crescent]20-magnolia crescent . What was going to happen to [him]117-harry ? Would [he]117-harry be arrested , or would [he]117-harry simply be outlawed from [the wizarding world]463-the wizarding world ? [He]117-harry thought of [Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione , and [his]117-harry heart sank even lower . [He]117-harry did n’t have any Muggle money , either . A funny prickling on the back of [his]117-harry neck had made [Harry]117-harry feel [he]117-harry was being watched , but [the street]394-the street appeared to be deserted , and no lights shone from [any of [the large square houses]571-the large square houses]570-any of the large square houses .

[BLACK]152-black STILL AT LARGE

[Harry]117-harry looked into the shadowed eyes of [Sirius Black]152-black , the only part of the sunken face that seemed alive . “ [Ar]175-ar , ”[171-ern] said [Ern]171-ern darkly .

“ [Hedwig]130-hedwig ! ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry gasped .

The snowy owl clicked [her]661-her beak and fluttered down onto [Harry]117-harry ’s arm .

“ Very smart owl [you]117-harry ’ve got there , ”[178-tom] chuckled [Tom]178-tom . “ Arrived about five minutes after [you]117-harry did . If there ’s anything [you]117-harry need , [Mr. Potter]151-mr. potter , do n’t hesitate to ask . ”[178-tom]

[He]117-harry gave another bow and left .

[Harry]117-harry sat on [his]117-harry bed for a long time , absentmindedly stroking [Hedwig]130-hedwig . The sky outside the window was changing rapidly from deep , velvety blue to cold , steely gray and then , slowly , to pink shot with gold . [Harry]117-harry could hardly believe that [he]117-harry ’d left [Privet Drive]1-privet drive only a few hours ago , that [he]117-harry was n’t expelled , and that [he]117-harry was now facing three completely Dursley - free weeks .

“ It ’s been a very weird night , [Hedwig]130-hedwig , ”[117-harry] [he]117-harry yawned .

And without even removing [his]117-harry glasses , [he]117-harry slumped back onto [his]117-harry pillows and fell asleep .

It took [Harry]117-harry several days to get used to [his]117-harry strange new freedom . Never before had [he]117-harry been able to get up whenever [he]117-harry wanted or eat whatever [he]117-harry fancied . [He]117-harry could even go wherever [he]117-harry pleased , as long as [it]662-it was in [Diagon Alley]28-diagon alley , and as [this long cobbled street]663-this long cobbled street was packed with [the most fascinating Wizarding shops in [the world]503-the world]664-the most fascinating wizarding shops in the world , [Harry]117-harry felt no desire to break [his]117-harry word to [Fudge]173-fudge and stray back into [the Muggle world]666-the muggle world .

[Harry]117-harry ate breakfast each morning in [the Leaky Cauldron]633-the leaky cauldron , where [he]117-harry liked watching [the other guests]668-the other guests : [funny little witches from [the country]509-the country]669-funny little witches from the country , up for a day ’s shopping ; [venerable - looking wizards]671-venerable - looking wizards arguing over the latest article in Transfiguration Today ; [wild - looking warlocks]672-wild - looking warlocks ; [raucous dwarfs]673-raucous dwarfs ; and once , what looked suspiciously like [a hag]674-a hag , who ordered a plate of raw liver from behind a thick woollen balaclava .

After breakfast [Harry]117-harry would go out into [the backyard]675-the backyard , take out [his]117-harry wand , tap the third brick from the left above the trash bin , and stand back as the archway into [Diagon Alley]28-diagon alley opened in the wall .

[Harry]117-harry spent the long sunny days exploring [the shops]676-the shops and eating under the brightly colored umbrellas outside [cafés]677-cafés , where [[his]117-harry fellow diners]678-his fellow diners were showing one another [their]678-his fellow diners purchases ( “ It ’s a lunascope , [old boy]2778-old boy — no more messing around with moon charts , see ? ”[678-his fellow diners] ) or else discussing the case of [Sirius Black]152-black ( “ Personally , [I]678-his fellow diners wo n’t let any of [the children]2779-the children out alone until [he]152-black ’s back in [Azkaban]25-azkaban ”[678-his fellow diners] ) . [Harry]117-harry did n’t have to do [his]117-harry homework under the blankets by flashlight anymore ; now [he]117-harry could sit in the bright sunshine outside [Florean Fortescue ’s Ice Cream Parlor]679-florean fortescue ’s ice cream parlor , finishing all [his]117-harry essays with occasional help from [Florean Fortescue]180-florean fortescue [himself]180-florean fortescue , who , apart from knowing a great deal about medieval witch burnings , gave [Harry]117-harry free sundaes every half an hour .

Once [Harry]117-harry had refilled [his]117-harry money bag with gold Galleons , silver Sickles , and bronze Knuts from [[his]117-harry vault at [Gringotts]30-gringotts]680-his vault at gringotts , [he]117-harry had to exercise a lot of self - control not to spend the whole lot at once . [He]117-harry had to keep reminding [himself]117-harry that [he]117-harry had five years to go at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts , and how it would feel to ask [the Dursleys]122-the dursleys for money for spellbooks , to stop [himself]117-harry from buying a handsome set of solid gold Gobstones ( a Wizarding game rather like marbles , in which the stones squirt a nasty - smelling liquid into [the other player]681-the other player ’s face when they lose a point ) . [He]117-harry was sorely tempted , too , by the perfect , moving model of the galaxy in a large glass ball , which would have meant [he]117-harry never had to take another Astronomy lesson . But the thing that tested [Harry]117-harry ’s resolution most appeared in [[his]117-harry favorite shop]682-his favorite shop , [Quality Quidditch Supplies]36-quality quidditch supplies , a week after [he]117-harry ’d arrived at [the Leaky Cauldron]33-the leaky cauldron .

“ Just come out — prototype — ”[687-a square - jawed wizard] [a square - jawed wizard]687-a square - jawed wizard was telling [[his]687-a square - jawed wizard companion]688-his companion .

[A large witch in front of Harry]694-a large witch in front of harry moved , and [he]117-harry was able to read the sign next to the broom :

THE FIREBOLT .

This state - of - the - art racing broom sports a streamlined , superfine handle of ash , treated with a diamond - hard polish and hand - numbered with its own registration number . Each individually selected birch twig in the broomtail has been honed to aerodynamic perfection , giving the Firebolt unsurpassable balance and pinpoint precision . [The Firebolt]181-the firebolt has an acceleration of 150 miles an hour in ten seconds and incorporates an unbreakable Braking Charm . Price on request .

Price on request ... [Harry]117-harry did n’t like to think how much gold the Firebolt would cost . [He]117-harry had never wanted anything as much in [his]117-harry whole life — but [he]117-harry had never lost a Quidditch match on [his]117-harry Nimbus Two Thousand , and what was the point in emptying [[his]117-harry Gringotts vault]695-his gringotts vault for the Firebolt , when [he]117-harry had a very good broom already ? [Harry]117-harry did n’t ask for the price , but [he]117-harry returned , almost every day after that , just to look at [the Firebolt]181-the firebolt .

[He]117-harry went to [the Apothecary]696-the apothecary to replenish [his]117-harry store of potions ingredients , and as [his]117-harry school robes were now several inches too short in the arm and leg , [he]117-harry visited [Madam Malkin]182-madam malkin ’s Robes for All Occasions and bought new ones . [Harry]117-harry got a surprise as [he]117-harry looked in at the bookshop window . Instead of the usual display of gold - embossed spellbooks the size of paving slabs , there was a large iron cage behind the glass that held about a hundred copies of The Monster Book of Monsters . Torn pages were flying everywhere as the books grappled with each other , locked together in furious wrestling matches and snapping aggressively .

[Harry]117-harry pulled [his]117-harry booklist out of [his]117-harry pocket and consulted it for the first time . The Monster Book of Monsters was listed as the required book for Care of Magical Creatures . Now [Harry]117-harry understood why [Hagrid]305-hagrid had said it would come in useful . “ [An ordinary common or garden rat like this]2801-an ordinary common or garden rat like this ca n’t be expected to live longer than three years or so , ”[742-the witch] said [the witch]742-the witch . “ Now , if [you]147-ron were looking for something a bit more hard - wearing , [you]147-ron might like one of these — ”[742-the witch]

“ Well , if [you]147-ron do n’t want a replacement , [you]147-ron can try this rat tonic , ”[742-the witch] said [the witch]742-the witch , reaching under the counter and bringing out a small red bottle .

“ Okay , ”[147-ron] said [Ron]147-ron . “ How much — OUCH ! ”[147-ron]

[Harry]117-harry lay listening to the muffled shouting next door and wondered why [he]117-harry did n’t feel more scared . “ What ’s going on ? ”[147-ron] said [Ron]147-ron ’s voice from behind [Harry]117-harry .

[Its]904-its face was completely hidden beneath its hood . [Harry]117-harry ’s eyes darted downward , and what [he]117-harry saw made [his]117-harry stomach contract . There was a hand protruding from the cloak and it was glistening , grayish , slimy - looking , and scabbed , like something dead that had decayed in water ...

But it was visible only for a split second . As though [the creature beneath the cloak]905-the creature beneath the cloak sensed [Harry]117-harry ’s gaze , the hand was suddenly withdrawn into the folds of [its]904-its black cloak .

And then the thing beneath the hood , whatever it was , drew a long , slow , rattling breath , as though it were trying to suck something more than air from its surroundings .

An intense cold swept over [them]902-them all . [Harry]117-harry felt [his]117-harry own breath catch in [his]117-harry chest . The cold went deeper than [his]117-harry skin . It was inside [his]117-harry chest , it was inside [his]117-harry very heart ...

[Harry]117-harry ’s eyes rolled up into [his]117-harry head . [He]117-harry could n’t see . [He]117-harry was drowning in cold . There was a rushing in [his]117-harry ears as though of water . [He]117-harry was being dragged downward , the roaring growing louder ...

And then , from far away , [he]117-harry heard screaming , terrible , terrified , pleading screams . [He]117-harry wanted to help whoever it was , [he]117-harry tried to move [his]117-harry arms , but could n’t ... a thick white fog was swirling around [him]117-harry , inside [him]117-harry —

“ Firs ’ years this way ! ”[305-hagrid] called a familiar voice . [The coach]930-the coach smelled faintly of mold and straw . [Harry]117-harry felt better since the chocolate , but still weak . [Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione kept looking at [him]117-harry sideways , as though frightened [he]117-harry might collapse again .

As [the carriage]896-the carriage trundled toward a pair of magnificent wrought iron gates , flanked with stone columns topped with winged boars , [Harry]117-harry saw [two more towering , hooded dementors , standing guard on either side]933-two more towering , hooded dementors , standing guard on either side . A wave of cold sickness threatened to engulf [him]117-harry again ; [he]117-harry leaned back into the lumpy seat and closed [his]117-harry eyes until [they]683-the crowd had passed the gates . [The carriage]896-the carriage picked up speed on [the long , sloping drive up to [the castle]807-the castle]935-the long , sloping drive up to the castle ; [Hermione]313-hermione was leaning out of the tiny window , watching [the many turrets and towers]937-the many turrets and towers draw nearer . As [Harry]117-harry stepped down , a drawling , delighted voice sounded in [his]117-harry ear .

“ [You]117-harry fainted , [Potter]117-harry ? Is [Longbottom]168-neville telling the truth ? [You]117-harry actually fainted ? ”[117-harry]

[Malfoy]200-malfoy elbowed past [Hermione]313-hermione to block [Harry]117-harry ’s way up the stone steps to [the castle]807-the castle , [his]117-harry face gleeful and [his]117-harry pale eyes glinting maliciously .

“ Shove off , [Malfoy]200-malfoy , ”[147-ron] said [Ron]147-ron , whose jaw was clenched .

“ Did [you]117-harry faint as well , [Weasley]140-ginny ? ”[200-malfoy] said [Malfoy]200-malfoy loudly . “ Did [the scary old dementor]2908-the scary old dementor frighten [you]117-harry too , [Weasley]140-ginny ? ”[200-malfoy]

“ Is there a problem ? ”[200-malfoy] said a mild voice . [Professor Lupin]195-lupin had just gotten out of [the next carriage]940-the next carriage .

[Malfoy]200-malfoy gave [Professor Lupin]195-lupin an insolent stare , which took in the patches on [his]195-lupin robes and the dilapidated suitcase . “ [You]117-harry ’ll forgive [me]219-professor trelawney for saying so , [[my]219-professor trelawney dear]2995-my dear , but [I]219-professor trelawney perceive very little aura around [you]2995-my dear . Very little receptivity to the resonances of the future . ”[219-professor trelawney]

[Seamus Finnigan]184-seamus finnigan was tilting [his]184-seamus finnigan head from side to side .

“ It looks like a Grim if [you]2995-my dear do this , ”[184-seamus finnigan] [he]184-seamus finnigan said , with [his]184-seamus finnigan eyes almost shut , “ but it looks more like a donkey from here , ”[184-seamus finnigan] [he]184-seamus finnigan said , leaning to the left .

[They]1102-them had the bodies , hind legs , and tails of horses , but the front legs , wings , and heads of what seemed to be giant eagles , with cruel , steel - colored beaks and large , brilliantly orange eyes . [Malfoy]200-malfoy , [Crabbe]201-crabbe , and [Goyle]202-goyle were n’t listening ; [they]1111-they were talking in an undertone and [Harry]117-harry had a nasty feeling [they]1111-they were plotting how best to disrupt the lesson .

[Most of the class]1046-most of the class backed farther away in answer . [Even Harry]117-harry , [Ron]147-ron , and [Hermione]313-hermione had misgivings . “ [No one]2805-no one ? ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid , with a pleading look .

“ [I]117-harry ’ll do it , ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry .

[He]305-hagrid untied one of the chains , pulled the gray hippogriff away from its fellows , and slipped off [its]1109-the hippogriffs leather collar . “ Easy , now , [Harry]117-harry , ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid quietly . “ [Yeh’ve]117-harry got eye contact , now try not [ter]117-harry blink ... [Hippogriffs]231-hippogriffs don ’ trust [yeh]117-harry if [yeh]117-harry blink too much ... ”[305-hagrid]

[Harry]117-harry ’s eyes immediately began to water , but [he]117-harry did n’t shut them . [Buckbeak]233-buckbeak had turned [his]233-buckbeak great , sharp head and was staring at [Harry]117-harry with one fierce orange eye .

“ Tha ’s it , ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid . “ Tha ’s it , [Harry]117-harry ... now , bow ... ”[305-hagrid]

[Harry]117-harry did n’t feel much like exposing the back of [his]117-harry neck to [Buckbeak]233-buckbeak , but [he]117-harry did as [he]117-harry was told . [He]117-harry gave a short bow and then looked up .

[The hippogriff]1116-the hippogriff was still staring haughtily at [him]117-harry . It did n’t move .

“ Ah , ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid , sounding worried . “ Right — back away , now , [Harry]117-harry , easy does it — ”[305-hagrid]

But then , to [Harry]117-harry ’s enormous surprise , the hippogriff suddenly bent its scaly front knees and sank into what was an unmistakable bow .

“ Well done , [Harry]117-harry ! ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid , ecstatic . “ Right — [yeh]117-harry can touch [him]1116-the hippogriff ! Pat [his]1116-the hippogriff beak , go on ! ”[305-hagrid]

Feeling that a better reward would have been to back away , [Harry]117-harry moved slowly toward [the hippogriff]1116-the hippogriff and reached out toward [it]1116-the hippogriff . [He]117-harry patted the beak several times and the hippogriff closed [its]1116-the hippogriff eyes lazily , as though enjoying it .

[The class]1047-the class broke into applause , all except for [Malfoy]200-malfoy , [Crabbe]201-crabbe , and [Goyle]202-goyle , who were looking deeply disappointed .

“ [Righ]234-righ ’ then , [Harry]117-harry , ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid . “ [I]305-hagrid reckon [he]1116-the hippogriff might ’ let [yeh]117-harry ride [him]1116-the hippogriff ! ”[305-hagrid]

This was more than [Harry]117-harry had bargained for . [He]117-harry was used to a broomstick ; but [he]117-harry was n’t sure [a hippogriff]1119-a hippogriff would be quite the same .

“ [Yeh]117-harry climb up there , jus ’ behind the wing joint , ”[305-hagrid] said [Hagrid]305-hagrid , “ an ’ mind [yeh]117-harry don ’ pull any of [his]1116-the hippogriff feathers out , [he]1116-the hippogriff won ’ like that ... ”[305-hagrid]

[Harry]117-harry put [his]117-harry foot on the top of [Buckbeak]233-buckbeak ’s wing and hoisted [himself]117-harry onto its back . [Buckbeak]233-buckbeak stood up . [Harry]117-harry was n’t sure where to hold on ; everything in front of [him]117-harry was covered with feathers .

“ Go on , then ! ”[305-hagrid] roared [Hagrid]305-hagrid , slapping [the hippogriff]1116-the hippogriff ’s hindquarters .

Without warning , twelve - foot wings flapped open on either side of [Harry]117-harry ; [he]117-harry just had time to seize [the hippogriff]1116-the hippogriff around the neck before [he]117-harry was soaring upward . It was nothing like a broomstick , and [Harry]117-harry knew which one [he]117-harry preferred ; [the hippogriff]1116-the hippogriff ’s wings beat uncomfortably on either side of [him]117-harry , catching [him]117-harry under [his]117-harry legs and making [him]117-harry feel [he]117-harry was about to be thrown off ; the glossy feathers slipped under [his]117-harry fingers and [he]117-harry did n’t dare get a stronger grip ; instead of the smooth action of [his]117-harry Nimbus Two Thousand , [he]117-harry now felt [himself]117-harry rocking backward and forward as the hindquarters of the hippogriff rose and fell with its wings .

[Buckbeak]233-buckbeak flew [him]117-harry once around [the paddock]1104-the paddock and then headed back to [the ground]1124-the ground ; this was the bit [Harry]117-harry had been dreading ; [he]117-harry leaned back as the smooth neck lowered , feeling [he]117-harry was going to slip off over the beak , then felt a heavy thud as the four ill - assorted feet hit the ground . [He]117-harry just managed to hold on and push [himself]117-harry straight again .

“ Good work , [Harry]117-harry ! ”[305-hagrid] roared [Hagrid]305-hagrid as everyone except [Malfoy]200-malfoy , [Crabbe]201-crabbe , and [Goyle]202-goyle cheered . “ Okay , who else wants a go ? ”[202-goyle]

[The wardrobe]1207-the wardrobe shook again , though not as much as [Neville]168-neville , who walked forward as though [he]168-neville were heading for the gallows .

[Nearly everyone]1209-nearly everyone laughed . [Even Neville]168-neville grinned apologetically . [Professor Lupin]195-lupin , however , looked thoughtful .

“ Yes , ”[168-neville] said [Neville]168-neville uncertainly , plainly wondering what was coming next .

There was a great shout of laughter . [The wardrobe]1207-the wardrobe wobbled more violently .

[The room]404-the room went quiet . [Harry]117-harry thought ... What scared [him]117-harry most in [the world]503-the world ?

[His]117-harry first thought was [Lord Voldemort]133-voldemort — a Voldemort returned to full strength . But before [he]117-harry had even started to plan a possible counterattack on [a boggart - Voldemort]133-voldemort , a horrible image came floating to the surface of [his]117-harry mind ...

A rotting , glistening hand , slithering back beneath a black cloak ... a long , rattling breath from an unseen mouth ... then a cold so penetrating it felt like drowning ...

[Harry]117-harry shivered , then looked around , hoping [no one]2805-no one had noticed . [Many people]1214-many people had [their]1214-many people eyes shut tight . [Ron]147-ron was muttering to [himself]147-ron , “ Take its legs off . ”[147-ron] [Harry]117-harry was sure [he]117-harry knew what that was about . [Ron]147-ron ’s greatest fear was spiders .

“ [Everyone]769-everyone ready ? ”[195-lupin] said [Professor Lupin]195-lupin .

[Harry]117-harry felt a lurch of fear . [He]117-harry was n’t ready . How could [you]1215-you make [a dementor]2898-a dementor less frightening ? But [he]117-harry did n’t want to ask for more time ; [everyone else]487-everyone else was nodding and rolling up [their]487-everyone else sleeves .

“ [Neville]168-neville , [we]487-everyone else ’re going to back away , ”[195-lupin] said [Professor Lupin]195-lupin . “ Let [you]168-neville have a clear field , all right ? “ [Crookshanks]251-crookshanks does n’t understand it ’s wrong ! ”[313-hermione] said [Hermione]313-hermione , [her]313-hermione voice shaking . “ All cats chase rats , [Ron]147-ron ! ”[313-hermione]

[Harry]117-harry stared . Not only was this the last answer [he]117-harry ’d expected , but [Lupin]195-lupin had said [Voldemort]133-voldemort ’s name . “ Clearly , [I]195-lupin was wrong , ”[195-lupin] said [Lupin]195-lupin , still frowning at [Harry]117-harry . “ But [I]195-lupin did n’t think it a good idea for [Lord Voldemort]133-voldemort to materialize in [the staffroom]1193-the staffroom . “ But then , ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry honestly . “ [I]117-harry — [I]117-harry remembered [those dementors]2958-those dementors . ”[117-harry]

“ [I]195-lupin see , ”[195-lupin] said [Lupin]195-lupin thoughtfully . “ Well , well ... [Harry]117-harry did n’t know what to say to that , so [he]117-harry drank some more tea .

“ So [you]117-harry ’ve been thinking that [I]195-lupin did n’t believe [you]117-harry capable of fighting [the boggart]3104-the boggart ? ”[195-lupin] said [Lupin]195-lupin shrewdly .

[Percy]143-percy looked slightly abashed . [Dumbledore]210-dumbledore left [the hall]522-the hall , walking quickly and quietly . [Harry]117-harry glanced sideways at [Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione . [Both of [them]726-both of them]726-both of them had [their]726-both of them eyes open too , reflecting the starry ceiling .

“ What was all that about ? ”[147-ron] [Ron]147-ron mouthed .

[The school]805-the school talked of nothing but [Sirius Black]152-black for the next few days . [Harry]117-harry woke extremely early the next morning ; so early that it was still dark . For a moment [he]117-harry thought the roaring of the wind had woken [him]117-harry . Then [he]117-harry felt a cold breeze on the back of [his]117-harry neck and sat bolt upright — [Peeves]239-peeves [the Poltergeist]1350-the poltergeist had been floating next to [him]117-harry , blowing hard in [his]117-harry ear .

“ What did [you]239-peeves do that for ? ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry furiously .

[Peeves]239-peeves puffed out [his]239-peeves cheeks , blew hard , and zoomed backward out of [the room]404-the room , cackling .

[Harry]117-harry fumbled for [his]117-harry alarm clock and looked at it . It was half past four . [Cursing Peeves]239-peeves , [he]117-harry rolled over and tried to get back to sleep , but it was very difficult , now that [he]117-harry was awake , to ignore the sounds of the thunder rumbling overhead , the pounding of the wind against the castle walls , and the distant creaking of the trees in [the Forbidden Forest]62-the forbidden forest . In a few hours [he]117-harry would be out on [the Quidditch field]1388-the quidditch field , battling through that gale . Finally , [he]117-harry gave up any thought of more sleep , got up , dressed , picked up [his]117-harry Nimbus Two Thousand , and walked quietly out of [the dormitory]1419-the dormitory .

As [Harry]117-harry opened the door , something brushed against [his]117-harry leg . [He]117-harry bent down just in time to grab [Crookshanks]251-crookshanks by the end of [his]251-crookshanks bushy tail and drag [him]251-crookshanks outside .

“ [You]251-crookshanks know , [I]117-harry reckon [Ron]147-ron was right about [you]251-crookshanks , ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry told [Crookshanks]251-crookshanks suspiciously . “ There are plenty of mice around [this place]3038-this place — go and chase [them]3261-them . The noise of the storm was even louder in [the common room]1008-the common room . [Harry]117-harry knew better than to think the match would be canceled ; Quidditch matches were n’t called off for trifles like thunderstorms . Nevertheless , [he]117-harry was starting to feel very apprehensive . [Wood]247-wood had pointed out [Cedric Diggory]272-diggory to [him]117-harry in [the corridor]852-the corridor ; [Diggory]272-diggory was a fifth year and a lot bigger than [Harry]117-harry . Seekers were usually light and speedy , but [Diggory]272-diggory ’s weight would be an advantage in this weather because [he]272-diggory was less likely to be blown off course .

[Harry]117-harry whiled away the hours until dawn in front of the fire , getting up every now and then to stop [Crookshanks]251-crookshanks from sneaking up [the boys]1280-the boys ’ staircase again . At long last [Harry]117-harry thought it must be time for breakfast , so [he]117-harry headed through the portrait hole alone .

“ Stand and fight , [you]117-harry mangy cur ! ”[217-sir cadogan] yelled [Sir Cadogan]217-sir cadogan .

“ Oh , shut up , ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry yawned .

[He]117-harry revived a bit over a large bowl of porridge , and by the time [he]117-harry ’d started on toast , [the rest of [the team]3128-the team]1391-the rest of the team had turned up .

“ It ’s going to be a tough one , ”[247-wood] said [Wood]247-wood , who was n’t eating anything .

“ Stop worrying , [Oliver]247-wood , ”[248-alicia] said [Alicia]248-alicia soothingly , “ [we]3128-the team do n’t mind a bit of rain . ”[248-alicia]

But it was considerably more than a bit of rain . Such was the popularity of [Quidditch]274-quidditch that [the whole school]1426-the whole school turned out to watch the match as usual , but [they]3128-the team ran down [the lawns]1427-the lawns toward [the Quidditch field]1388-the quidditch field , heads bowed against the ferocious wind , umbrellas being whipped out of [their]3128-the team hands as [they]3128-the team went . Just before [he]117-harry entered [the locker room]1429-the locker room , [Harry]117-harry saw [Malfoy]200-malfoy , [Crabbe]201-crabbe , and [Goyle]202-goyle , laughing and pointing at [him]117-harry from under an enormous umbrella on [their]3128-the team way to [the stadium]1430-the stadium .

[The team]3128-the team changed into [their]3128-the team scarlet robes and waited for [Wood]247-wood ’s usual pre - match pep talk , but it did n’t come . [He]117-harry tried to speak several times , made an odd gulping noise , then shook [his]117-harry head hopelessly and beckoned [them]3128-the team to follow [him]117-harry .

The wind was so strong that [they]3128-the team staggered sideways as [they]3128-the team walked out onto [the field]1263-the field . If [the crowd]683-the crowd was cheering , [they]3128-the team could n’t hear it over the fresh rolls of thunder . Rain was splattering over [Harry]117-harry ’s glasses . How on earth was [he]117-harry going to see [the Snitch]1434-the snitch in this ?

[The Hufflepuffs]275-the hufflepuffs were approaching from the opposite side of [the field]1263-the field , wearing canary - yellow robes . [The Captains]1436-the captains walked up to [each other]985-each other and shook hands ; [Diggory]272-diggory smiled at [Wood]247-wood but [Wood]247-wood now looked as though [he]247-wood had lockjaw and merely nodded . [Harry]117-harry saw [Madam Hooch]270-madam hooch ’s mouth form the words , “ Mount [your]117-harry brooms . ”[117-harry] [He]117-harry pulled [his]117-harry right foot out of the mud with a squelch and swung it over [his]117-harry Nimbus Two Thousand . [Madam Hooch]270-madam hooch put [her]270-madam hooch whistle to [her]270-madam hooch lips and gave it a blast that sounded shrill and distant — [they]1438-they were off .

[Harry]117-harry rose fast , but [his]117-harry Nimbus was swerving slightly with the wind . [He]117-harry held it as steady as [he]117-harry could and turned , squinting into the rain .

Within five minutes [Harry]117-harry was soaked to [his]117-harry skin and frozen , hardly able to see [[his]117-harry teammates]1439-his teammates , let alone [the tiny Snitch]1440-the tiny snitch . [He]117-harry flew backward and forward across [the field]1263-the field past blurred red and yellow shapes , with no idea of what was happening in the rest of the game . [He]117-harry could n’t hear the commentary over the wind . [The crowd]683-the crowd was hidden beneath a sea of cloaks and battered umbrellas . Twice [Harry]117-harry came very close to being unseated by [a Bludger]1443-a bludger ; [his]117-harry vision was so clouded by the rain on [his]117-harry glasses [he]117-harry had n’t seen them coming .

[He]117-harry lost track of time . It was getting harder and harder to hold [his]117-harry broom straight . The sky was getting darker , as though night had decided to come early . [Twice Harry]117-harry nearly hit [another player]1444-another player , without knowing whether it was [a teammate]1445-a teammate or [opponent]1446-opponent ; [everyone]769-everyone was now so wet , and the rain so thick , [he]117-harry could hardly tell [them]769-everyone apart ...

With the first flash of lightning came the sound of [Madam Hooch]270-madam hooch ’s whistle ; [Harry]117-harry could just see the outline of [Wood]247-wood through the thick rain , gesturing [him]247-wood to the ground . [The whole team]1448-the whole team splashed down into the mud .

“ [I]247-wood called for time - out ! ”[247-wood] [Wood]247-wood roared at [[his]247-wood team]1390-his team . “ Come on , under here — ”[247-wood]

[They]1448-the whole team huddled at the edge of [the field]1263-the field under a large umbrella ; [Harry]117-harry took off [his]117-harry glasses and wiped them hurriedly on [his]117-harry robes .

“ What ’s the score ? ”[117-harry]

“ [We]1448-the whole team ’re fifty points up , ”[247-wood] said [Wood]247-wood , “ but unless [we]1448-the whole team get the Snitch soon , [we]1448-the whole team ’ll be playing into the night . ”[247-wood]

“ [I]117-harry ’ve got no chance with these on , ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry said exasperatedly , waving [his]117-harry glasses .

At that very moment , [Hermione]313-hermione appeared at [his]117-harry shoulder ; [she]313-hermione was holding [her]313-hermione cloak over [her]313-hermione head and was , inexplicably , beaming .

“ [I]313-hermione ’ve had an idea , [Harry]117-harry ! Give [me]313-hermione [your]117-harry glasses , quick ! ”[313-hermione]

[He]117-harry handed them to [her]313-hermione , and as [the team]3128-the team watched in amazement , [Hermione]313-hermione tapped them with [her]313-hermione wand and said , “ Impervius ! ”[313-hermione]

“ There ! ”[313-hermione] [she]313-hermione said , handing them back to [Harry]117-harry . “ They ’ll repel water ! ”[313-hermione]

[Wood]247-wood looked as though [he]247-wood could have kissed [her]313-hermione .

“ Brilliant ! ”[247-wood] [he]247-wood called hoarsely after [her]313-hermione as [she]313-hermione disappeared into the crowd . “ Okay , [team]3262-team , let ’s go for it ! ”[247-wood]

[Hermione]313-hermione ’s spell had done the trick . [Harry]117-harry was still numb with cold , still wetter than [he]117-harry ’d ever been in [his]117-harry life , but [he]117-harry could see . Full of fresh determination , [he]117-harry urged [his]117-harry broom through the turbulent air , staring in every direction for [the Snitch]1434-the snitch , avoiding [a Bludger]1443-a bludger , ducking beneath [Diggory]272-diggory , who was streaking in the opposite direction ...

There was another clap of thunder , followed immediately by forked lightning . This was getting more and more dangerous . [Harry]117-harry needed to get [the Snitch]223-the snitch quickly —

[He]117-harry turned , intending to head back toward the middle of [the field]1263-the field , but at that moment , another flash of lightning illuminated [the stands]1455-the stands , and [Harry]117-harry saw something that distracted [him]117-harry completely — the silhouette of an enormous shaggy black dog , clearly imprinted against the sky , motionless in the topmost , empty row of seats .

[Harry]117-harry ’s numb hands slipped on the broom handle and [his]117-harry Nimbus dropped a few feet . Shaking [his]117-harry sodden bangs out of [his]117-harry eyes , [he]117-harry squinted back into [the stands]1455-the stands . The dog had vanished .

“ [Harry]117-harry ! ”[247-wood] came [Wood]247-wood ’s anguished yell from the Gryffindor goalposts . “ [Harry]117-harry , behind [you]117-harry ! ”[247-wood]

[Harry]117-harry looked wildly around . [Cedric Diggory]272-diggory was pelting up [the field]1263-the field , and a tiny speck of gold was shimmering in the rain - filled air between [them]1458-them —

With a jolt of panic , [Harry]117-harry threw [himself]117-harry flat to the broom - handle and zoomed toward [the Snitch]223-the snitch .

“ Come on ! ”[117-harry] [he]117-harry growled at [his]117-harry Nimbus as the rain whipped [his]117-harry face . “ Faster ! ”[117-harry]

But something odd was happening . An eerie silence was falling across [the stadium]1430-the stadium . The wind , though as strong as ever , was forgetting to roar . It was as though [someone]572-someone had turned off the sound , as though [Harry]117-harry had gone suddenly deaf — what was going on ?

And then a horribly familiar wave of cold swept over [him]117-harry , inside [him]117-harry , just as [he]117-harry became aware of something moving on the field below ...

Before [he]117-harry ’d had time to think , [Harry]117-harry had taken [his]117-harry eyes off the Snitch and looked down .

[At least a hundred dementors]1461-at least a hundred dementors , [their]1461-at least a hundred dementors hidden faces pointing up at [him]117-harry , were standing beneath [him]117-harry . [Someone]572-someone was screaming , screaming inside [his]117-harry head ... [a woman]1463-a woman ...

[He]117-harry was falling , falling through the icy mist .

“ Lucky the ground was so soft . ”[1464-the woman]

[Harry]117-harry could hear the voices whispering , but they made no sense whatsoever . [The Gryffindor team]1387-the gryffindor team visited again on Sunday morning , this time accompanied by [Wood]247-wood , who told [Harry]117-harry ( in a hollow , dead sort of voice ) that [he]247-wood did n’t blame [him]117-harry in the slightest . But nothing [anyone]387-anyone said or did could make [Harry]117-harry feel any better , because [they]1487-they knew only half of what was troubling [him]117-harry .

[He]117-harry had n’t told [anyone]387-anyone about [the Grim]223-the snitch , not even [Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione , because [he]117-harry knew [Ron]147-ron would panic and [Hermione]313-hermione would scoff . And then there were [the dementors]2939-the dementors . [Harry]117-harry felt sick and humiliated every time [he]117-harry thought of [them]2939-the dementors . [They]1506-they had a very enjoyable lesson . [Professor Lupin]195-lupin had brought along a glass box containing a hinkypunk , a little one - legged creature who looked as though [he]1507-he were made of wisps of smoke , rather frail and harmless - looking .

[The hinkypunk]278-the hinkypunk made a horrible squelching noise against the glass .

When the bell rang , [everyone]769-everyone gathered up [their]769-everyone things and headed for the door , [Harry]117-harry among [them]769-everyone , but —

“ [I]195-lupin heard about the match , ”[195-lupin] said [Lupin]195-lupin , turning back to [his]195-lupin desk and starting to pile books into [his]195-lupin briefcase , “ and [I]195-lupin ’m sorry about [your]117-harry broomstick . Is there any chance of fixing it ? ”[195-lupin]

“ No , ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry . “ The tree smashed it to bits . ”[117-harry]

[Lupin]195-lupin sighed .

“ [They]3276-they planted the Whomping Willow the same year that [I]195-lupin arrived at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts . [People]2759-people used to play a game , trying to get near enough to touch the trunk . In the end , [a boy called [Davey Gudgeon]279-davey gudgeon]3278-a boy called davey gudgeon nearly lost an eye , and [we]3279-we were forbidden to go near it . No broomstick would have a chance . ”[195-lupin]

“ Did [you]195-lupin hear about [the dementors]2939-the dementors too ? ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry with difficulty .

[Lupin]195-lupin looked at [him]117-harry quickly .

“ Yes , [I]195-lupin did . [I]195-lupin do n’t think any of [us]3279-we have seen [Professor Dumbledore]210-dumbledore that angry . [They]2939-the dementors have been growing restless for some time ... furious at [his]210-dumbledore refusal to let [them]2939-the dementors inside [the grounds]2927-the grounds ... “ Yes , ”[117-harry] said [Harry]117-harry . [He]117-harry hesitated , and then the question [he]117-harry had to ask burst from [him]117-harry before [he]117-harry could stop [himself]117-harry . “ Why ? “ It has nothing to do with weakness , ”[195-lupin] said [Professor Lupin]195-lupin sharply , as though [he]195-lupin had read [Harry]117-harry ’s mind . “ [The dementors]2939-the dementors affect [you]117-harry worse than the others because there are horrors in [your]117-harry past that [the others]841-the others do n’t have . ”[195-lupin]

A ray of wintery sunlight fell across [the classroom]1041-the classroom , illuminating [Lupin]195-lupin ’s gray hairs and the lines on [his]195-lupin young face .

“ [Dementors]280-dementors are among the foulest creatures that walk [this earth]3284-this earth . [They]280-dementors infest the darkest , filthiest places , [they]280-dementors glory in decay and despair , [they]280-dementors drain peace , hope , and happiness out of the air around [them]280-dementors . [Even Muggles]120-muggles feel [their]280-dementors presence , though [they]120-muggles ca n’t see [them]280-dementors . [You]117-harry ’ll be left with nothing but the worst experiences of [your]117-harry life . [You]117-harry have nothing to feel ashamed of . ”[195-lupin]

“ When [they]280-dementors get near [me]117-harry — ”[117-harry] [Harry]117-harry stared at [Lupin]195-lupin ’s desk , [his]117-harry throat tight . “ [I]117-harry can hear [Voldemort]133-voldemort murdering [[my]117-harry mum]3288-my mum . ”[117-harry]

[Lupin]195-lupin made a sudden motion with [his]195-lupin arm as though to grip [Harry]117-harry ’s shoulder , but thought better of it . There was a moment ’s silence , then —

“ [They]280-dementors ’re getting hungry , ”[195-lupin] said [Lupin]195-lupin coolly , shutting [his]195-lupin briefcase with a snap . “ [Dumbledore]210-dumbledore wo n’t let [them]280-dementors into [the school]805-the school , so [their]280-dementors supply of human prey has dried up ... What with the promise of anti - dementor lessons from [Lupin]195-lupin , the thought that [he]195-lupin might never have to hear [[his]195-lupin mother]1384-his mother ’s death again , and the fact that [Ravenclaw]266-ravenclaw flattened Hufflepuff in [their]1511-their Quidditch match at the end of November , [Harry]117-harry ’s mood took a definite upturn . [Gryffindor]209-gryffindor were not out of the running after all , although [they]1511-their could not afford to lose another match . [Wood]247-wood became repossessed of [his]247-wood manic energy , and worked [[his]247-wood team]1390-his team as hard as ever in the chilly haze of rain that persisted into December . [Harry]117-harry saw no hint of a dementor within [the grounds]2927-the grounds . Two weeks before the end of the term , the sky lightened suddenly to a dazzling , opaline white and [the muddy grounds]1515-the muddy grounds were revealed one morning covered in glittering frost . Inside [the castle]807-the castle , there was a buzz of Christmas in the air . [Professor Flitwick]208-professor flitwick , [the Charms teacher]1335-the charms teacher , had already decorated [[his]1335-the charms teacher classroom]1518-his classroom with shimmering lights that turned out to be real , fluttering fairies . [The students]980-the students were all happily discussing [their]980-the students plans for the holidays . [Both Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione had decided to remain at [Hogwarts]3-hogwarts , and though [Ron]147-ron said it was because [he]147-ron could n’t stand two weeks with [Percy]143-percy , and [Hermione]313-hermione insisted [she]313-hermione needed to use [the library]3155-the library , [Harry]117-harry was n’t fooled ; [they]1511-their were doing it to keep [him]117-harry company , and [he]117-harry was very grateful .

To [everyone]769-everyone ’s delight except [Harry]117-harry ’s , there was to be another [Hogsmeade]16-hogsmeade trip on the very last weekend of the term .

“ [We]1511-their can do all [our]1511-their Christmas shopping there ! ”[313-hermione] said [Hermione]313-hermione . “ [Mum]142-mum and [Dad]141-dad would really love those Toothflossing Stringmints from [Honeydukes]49-honeydukes ! ”[313-hermione]

Resigned to the fact that [he]117-harry would be the only third year staying behind again , [Harry]117-harry borrowed a copy of Which Broomstick from Wood , and decided to spend the day reading up on the different makes . [He]117-harry had been riding one of the school brooms at team practice , an ancient Shooting Star , which was very slow and jerky ; [he]117-harry definitely needed a new broom of [his]117-harry own .

On the Saturday morning of the Hogsmeade trip , [Harry]117-harry bid good - bye to [Ron]147-ron and [Hermione]313-hermione , who were wrapped in cloaks and scarves , then turned up the marble staircase alone , and headed back toward [Gryffindor Tower]56-gryffindor tower . Snow had started to fall outside the windows , and [the castle]807-the castle was very still and quiet .

“ Psst — [Harry]117-harry ! ”[117-harry]

[He]117-harry turned , halfway along [the third - floor corridor]1523-the third - floor corridor , to see [Fred]144-fred and [George]145-george peering out at [him]117-harry from behind a statue of [a humpbacked , one - eyed witch]1524-a humpbacked , one - eyed witch .

[He]117-harry nodded toward [an empty classroom to the left of the one - eyed statue]1525-an empty classroom to the left of the one - eyed statue . “ Early Christmas present for [you]117-harry , [Harry]117-harry , ”[117-harry] [he]117-harry said .

[Fred]144-fred pulled something from inside [his]144-fred cloak with a flourish and laid it on one of the desks . It was a large , square , very worn piece of parchment with nothing written on it . [Harry]117-harry , suspecting one of [Fred]144-fred and [George]145-george ’s jokes , stared at it .

“ What ’s that supposed to be ? ”[117-harry]

“ Well ... when [we]3304-we were in [our]3304-we first year , [Harry]117-harry — young , carefree , and innocent — ”[117-harry]
